The American Red Cross has staff presence in Nairobi and supported the Kenya Red Cross Society (KRCS) in developing the cash transfer programming component of the International Federation appeal.

MDRPH010

Name: MDRPH010
Response_Strategy_Comments__c: The American Red Cross has contributed $50,000, earmarked for relief supplies, and $174,000 earmarked for cash transfer programming to the International Federation1 appeal.

Name: MDRSL003
Response_Strategy_Comments__c: The American Red Cross is deploying an IT/telecoms specialist to join the recently deployed information management and reporting specialist on the International Federations Field Assessment and Coordination Team (FACT). This multi-national team will work closely with the Sierra Leone Red Cross to support the on-going assessment and planning of the cholera response operation.

Name: MDRSL003
Response_Strategy_Comments__c: The American Red Cross is deploying an IT/telecoms specialist to join the recently deployed information management and reporting specialist on the International Federations Field Assessment and Coordination Team (FACT). This multi-national team will work closely with the Sierra Leone Red Cross to support the on-going assessment and planning of the cholera response operation.

Name: MDRBD010
Response_Strategy_Comments__c: The American Red Cross supported the initial International Federation1 appeal with a $100,000 contribution, earmarked for the cash transfer program component of the response. The American Red Cross deployed a cash transfer programming delegate to Bangladesh to support the original response operation. A second cash transfer programming delegate was deployed in response to the October storm.

Name: MDRNG014
Response_Strategy_Comments__c: The American Red Cross deployed a relief/shelter specialist to join the International Federations Field Assessment and Coordination Team (FACT). The American Red Cross has also committed $100,000 to the International Federation emergency appeal.

Name: MDRPH011
Response_Strategy_Comments__c: The American Red Cross has committed $50,000 to the International Federation1 preliminary emergency appeal in support of relief supply distribution. The American Red Cross will also contribute $50,000 to support the International Committee of the Red Cross preliminary appeal.

Name: MDRZW006
Response_Strategy_Comments__c: The American Red Cross has committed $50,000 to support water and sanitation activities through the International Federation1 appeal and continues to monitor the situation.

Name: Hostage Crisis in Beslan, North Ossetia
MDRMZ010
Response_Strategy_Comments__c: The American Red Cross has committed $100,000 to the International Federation1 appeal for the procurement and distribution of kitchen sets and shelter kits.

Name: MDRCD013
Response_Strategy_Comments__c: The American Red Cross deployed one disaster management specialist to lead the International Federations1 Field Assessment and Coordination Team (FACT). The team worked closely with the DRC Red Cross to support assessments and response planning along the Ubangi River. The American Red Cross has also committed $150,000 to the International Federation1 appeal for the procurement and distribution of relief supplies.

Name: MDRZW008
Response_Strategy_Comments__c: The American Red Cross has committed $50,000 to the International Federation1 appeal to support the response operation. This contribution will help the Zimbabwe Red Cross provide immediate relief to the affected populations including cash grants for food, water, and agriculture support.

Name: MDRPH014
Response_Strategy_Comments__c: The American Red Cross has deployed 43disaster specialists to the Philippines to support relief, emergency cash grant distributions, water and sanitation, shelter, IM, and an early recover assessment. The American Red Cross has pledged or committed a total of US $28 million to the global Red Cross response to support relief distributions, shelter activities, staff and goods. ARC has also contributed 42,075 supplies (20,000 jerry cans, 22,075 mosquito nets, 2,075 tarps).

Name: MDRPY015
Response_Strategy_Comments__c: The American Red Cross has committed $50,000 to the International Federationappeal to support the Paraguayan Red Cross response operation. This contribution will help the Paraguayan Red Cross provide immediate relief to the affected populations with relief supplies.

Name: MDRPH013
Response_Strategy_Comments__c: The American Red Cross has committed $145,000 to the IFRC1 emergency appeal to support the Philippine Red Cross (PRCS) response efforts. This contribution will help the Philippine Red Cross provide relief, shelter supplies and cash grants to people affected by the earthquake.

Name: MDRVN012
Response_Strategy_Comments__c: The American Red Cross is deploying a disaster specialist to support the response operation with monitoring the disbursement of grants for affected families. The American Red Cross has also contributed $100,000 to the International Federation1 appeal to enable the Vietnam Red Cross to provide cash grants for shelter repair and basic household items.

Name: MDRMH001
Response_Strategy_Comments__c: The American Red Cross is deploying a logistics specialist to the Marshall Islands for six weeks to support the International Federation response operation. The American Red Cross has also provided a contribution of $40,000 to the International Federation1 appeal.

Name: MDRPH012
Response_Strategy_Comments__c: The American Red Cross has committed $241,748 to the International Federation appeal to support the response efforts of the Philippine Red Cross (PRCS). This contribution will support the Philippine Red Cross in water and sanitation, shelter, and early recovery activities.

Name: MDRNA008
Response_Strategy_Comments__c: The American Red Cross has committed $70,000 to the International Federation1 appeal to support the response operation. This contribution will help the Namibia Red Cross provide immediate relief including food, emergency relief items, and cash grants to the affected populations. The American Red Cross has also deployed one specialist to support the Namibia Red Cross with the distribution of cash grants for food.

Name: MDRBD013
Response_Strategy_Comments__c: The American Red Cross has committed $100,000 to the International Federation1 appeal for cash grants which will allow people to purchase food, essential household items and materials to repair their homes.

Name: MDR49008
Response_Strategy_Comments__c:
The American Red Cross has spent and committed $19.4 million towards cholera prevention and response efforts in Haiti since 2010, reaching nearly 3.2 million people. These efforts have included shipping supplies, mobilizing health teams and volunteers, helping establish treatment facilities, distributing clean water, and launching nationwide public education campaigns using cell phones and weekly radio shows to spread prevention messages.
The American Red Cross recognizes the long-term effects of underfunded and low-profile disasters on communities and has therefore committed $225,000 to the IFRC emergency appeal to support the Dominican Red Cross cholera response efforts. This contribution will help the Dominican Red Cross implement a community-based health program to reduce the risk of infection and exposure to cholera for people living in the countrys most vulnerable areas and increase the capacity of the Dominican Red Cross to mobilize volunteers in affected communities.

Name: MDRUG037
Response_Strategy_Comments__c: The American Red Cross has committed $125,000 to the International Federation1 appeal to support the response operation. This contribution will help the Uganda Red Cross provide immediate relief to the affected populations including water and sanitation and shelter.
